title: How to stab a polytope
abstract:
We study the set of linear subspaces of a fixed dimension intersecting a
given polytope. To describe this set as a semialgebraic subset of a
Grassmannian, we introduce a Schubert arrangement of the polytope, defined by
the Chow forms of the polytope's faces of complementary dimension. We show that
the set of subspaces intersecting a specified family of faces is defined by
fixing the sign of the Chow forms of their boundaries. We give inequalities
defining the set of stabbing subspaces in terms of sign conditions on the Chow
form.
